Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Don't show Usabilla button if it's blocked" (#8208) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Address https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7784

Many tracker blockers prevent Usabilla from fully loading leaving a dead "Feedback" button on the page. This is a poor user experience.

Best view when hiding the whitespace:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8208/files?diff=unified&w=1

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y]Reset button for advanced search filtering does not have sufficient contrast" (#8152) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11051729/89946316-94da2f80-dbd7-11ea-82c5-21c0a815589a.png)
Title: WCAG 1.4.3: Ensures the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA contrast ratio thresholds (#reset-advanced-search)
Tags: Accessibility, WCAG 1.4.3, color-contrast

Issue: Ensures the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA contrast ratio thresholds (color-contrast - https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.5/color-contrast?application=msftAI)

Target application: NuGet Gallery | Packages - https://www.nuget.org/packages

Element path: #reset-advanced-search

Snippet: <input id="reset-advanced-search" class="btn btn-link form-control" type="button" value="Reset">

How to fix: 
Fix any of the following:
  Element has insufficient color contrast of 4.14 (foreground color: #337ab7, background color: #f4f4f4, font size: 10.5pt (14px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1

Environment: Chrome version 84.0.4147.125

====

This accessibility issue was found using Accessibility Insights for Web 2.20.0 (axe-core 3.5.1), a tool that helps find and fix accessibility issues. Get more information & download this tool at http://aka.ms/AccessibilityInsights.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[A11y] Color contrast issues on package details page, links on the selected version" (#8091) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Issue: Ensures the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA contrast ratio thresholds (color-contrast - https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/3.5/color-contrast?application=msftAI) Target application: `NuGet Gallery | Newtonsoft.Json 12.0.3 - https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/` Element paths: `a[title="\31 2\.0\.3"]` Snippet: ` 12.0.3 ` Element path: `.bg-info > td:nth-child(4) > a` Snippet: `Listed` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/86853070-af663980-c06a-11ea-9f94-4ab49b43c88a.png) How to fix: Fix any of the following: Element has insufficient color contrast of 3.77 (foreground color: #337ab7, background color: #d9edf7, font size: 12.0pt (16px), font weight: normal). Expected contrast ratio of 4.5:1 Environment: Chrome version 83.0.4103.116

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use [AppliesToProject] on IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider implementations" (#10044) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Visual Studio has recently [added `[AppliesToProject]`](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/271500) support for `IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider` providers, which can be used to prevent unneeded dlls. NuGet should use this for all their implementations to avoid unneeded loads of this dll in projects/solutions where it is not applicable, for example:

``` C#
    [Export(typeof(IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider))]
    [Name(nameof(PackageReferenceAttachedCollectionSourceProvider))]
    [Order(Before = HierarchyItemsProviderNames.Contains)]
    [AppliesToProject("DependenciesTree")] 
```

This is required to fix this [performance gate that was broken](https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1136214) that got an exception for 16.7.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet pack with nuspec does not automatically include lib directory" (#10043) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a new classlib (`dotnet new classlib`)
1. Generate a `.nuspec` for it.
1. Add an empty [`<files>`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/nuspec#files) element to the `nuspec`
1. `msbuild /restore`
1. copy the `bin/Debug` directory into the project root and rename it `lib`
1. `msbuild /t:pack /p:NuspecFile=.nuspec /p:NuspecBasePath=.` 

### Expected Results

A nupkg is generated that includes everything in `lib\` automatically.

### Actual Results

Pack will fail because the package is empty. 

### Notes

This _should_ work, [according to our docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/create-packages/creating-a-package#add-a-readme-and-other-files):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17535/93406366-583bcc80-f844-11ea-90c9-65d9af80dd5a.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PM UI:  NullReferenceException when signature validation fails" (#10042) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
1.  Create a new test certificate [`.\CreateTestCertificate.ps1 –AddAsTrustedRootAuthority`](https://github.com/NuGet/Entropy/tree/master/TestCertGenerator).
2.  Sign a package:  `NuGet.exe sign <PackageFilePath> -CertificatePath <PfxFilePath>`.
3.  Create a project.
4.  Add a NuGet.config file to the solution with the following content:
```XML
<configuration>
    <config>
        <add key="signatureValidationMode" value="require" />
    </config>
</configuration>
```
5.  Save, close, and reopen the solution.
6.  Open NuGet PM UI.
7.  Add a package source for the directory containing the package signed in step 2.
8.  Attempt to install that package.

Result:

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
at [`NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.dll!NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.NuGetUI.ProcessSignatureIssues(NuGet.Packaging.Signing.SignatureException ex)`](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/14fa722fbfeb9b485e86dac5c20e589de9138bf5/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/UserInterfaceService/NuGetUI.cs#L411)
